page.title: 10THE PRINCESS ALICE HOSPICE
page.content: The Princess Alice Hospice project has been the focus of a major community fund-raising effort over the last two years.The Hospice movement is attracting a great deal of interest at present.Hospitals do not have the resources to give as much help to the terminally ill as they and their families need.In the hospice,patients will be able to die with dignity. The Hospice is at the corner of Lammas Lane and West End Lane,Esher.Now the building is finished,the Hospice Trust still needs donations to meet running costs. They hope to add a day care centre later. There are only 26 beds for 700,000 living in a 10-mile radius of Esher,so the Hospice will only meet a fraction of the potential demand.Some other parts of the country are not even fortunate enough to have this.
